course_title: American Legal History: Colonial Era to 1900
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 35 / Seats Avail: 27Waitlist Total: 0 of 5
course_description:
This course will examine the historical development of American legal doctrine and
institutions from the late colonial period through the close of the nineteenth century. The principle substantive areas will include the treatment of Native Americans, and the post-Civil War Reconstruction Amendments. In addition to legal doctrine, the lectures and readings will consider   aspects of the social and political history of American law and the judiciary,
including the codification movement and the rise of elective judiciaries in the states.
